subject: Re: [junit] assertTrue(true)
msgSnippet: ... Exception messages should not be shown to the end-user, period. They are for developers, not for users. As such it s not nearly as crucial to localize them
messageBody:
Cedric Beust wrote:

> I don't think it's a good idea to assert against exception messages since
> your tests will be hard to port when you internationalize your application.
> At the very least, make this dependent on a key and a bundle.

Exception messages should not be shown to the end-user, period. They are
for developers, not for users. As such it's not nearly as crucial to
localize them since generally either:

A. The development team is monolingual and uses their language of choice
not just for exception messages but for comments, string constants,
variable names and more.

B. The development team is multilingual and multinational and uses
English for everything.

Of course error messages should be localized. These are shown to the end
user and are part of the user interface, just like menu items, window
titles, and other parts of the user interface. However, exception detail
messages make extremely poor error messages. It's important to
distinguish between these in a well-designed application, even if you're
only ever going to ship the app in a single language.
